revised_title: The Role of Corpus Luteum in Oestrus Inhibition and Pseudo-Pregnancy
tldr: The author investigates the functions of the corpus luteum, specifically its role in inhibiting oestrus and causing pseudo-pregnancy. They demonstrate that the corpus luteum is responsible for the oestrus-inhibiting activity during lactation and that it plays a crucial role in pseudo-pregnancy. The study also explores the effects of anterior pituitary extracts on the ovary and the possible presence of two distinct factors regulating ovarian activity in the anterior pituitary body.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
